Audio Description: On a white background a swath of pale blue highlights figure of the Statue of Liberty. Wearing a pale green draped dress and a crown with six spiked rays she faces to the left as the light shining from that direction highlights her face and upper body. In her right hand she lifts a large pale green burning torch with orange and yellow flames glowing at the top. Over this image are superimposed the flags of the countries belonging to the United Nations (from the top of the poster to the bottom): The United States, Great Britain, Russia, China, Australia, Belgium, Canada, Costa Rica, Cuba, Czechoslovakia, the Dominican Republic, El Salvador, Greece, Guatemala, Haiti, Honduras India, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Nicaragua, Norway, Panama, Poland, South Africa, and Yugoslavia. At the top of the poster in large black letters are the words “The United Nations fight for freedom.”
Creator: United States. Office of Facts and Figures. Graphics Division

Title: United Nations fight for freedom
